title: Banned accounts lose money spent!
body: Just a fair warning to all of you out there, Riot has taken to stealing your money by banning accounts permanently and not issuing refunds for the money spent on the banned account. This is blatant theft, and Riot is the judge, jury, and executioner. If you are like me, and have spent many years and dollars on this game, be forewarned and cease playing immediately. They have no interest in justice, only a quick and easy fix. Sorry Riot, but that will only result in a drastically negative chain reaction of lost loyalty and users.

Not quite. The consequence to being a dick SHOULD be the restriction of the account. The purchases on them can be disputed with creditors.

Disputing charges you know are valid on a credit card is felony fraud. People can (***and do***) go to jail for this. There are lawyers who are literally specialized in protecting businesses from this charge back fraud. You agreed to Riot's terms and services. You don't then get to decide the charges are fraudulent after ***YOU*** broke the contract ***that you agreed to***. 

So for anyone reading this guy's advice, dont do it. It is literally illegal.

I actually have a BA in Business administration and one of the sections we took courses in was Torts and Contracts. If information or understanding is asymmetric, some parts of a contract become voidable. 

If you actually read, btw, I didn't condone actually committing fraud. I said you can contest the charges with your creditor. If your creditor consents, then you had a legal foothold on which to argue your case.

Not Technically true. As a contract participation you have rights too. You have a right to dispute charges with a creditor if you feel that the vendor you purchased from has entered into a position where they are no longer offering you what you purchased, as long as that vendor is active.

League = one of the most Charge Back'd games in the world.

Now, if a Ban-ee does such, they can expect to have every account locked from future purchases and your credit source will block any future purchases from the vendor, so it's a cautious position to take. They also usually only have a limited period in which they will review like 3 months.

They do have the right to dispute the charges. Riot just won't directly refund them.
